isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - Meritor Medium Duty Front Drive Steer Axle - Removal and Disassembly - Remove Hub From Axle

step1.para: Remove the capscrews and washers that connect the hubcap to the drive flange. Remove the hubcap (Figure 8).
Remove snap ring from end of axle shaft (Figure 9).
Remove the capscrews and washers that connect the drive flange to the wheel hub (Figure 10).

caution.para: To loosen the drive flange from the hub, hit the flange with a soft mallet. Do not pry off the parts with a sharp tool.

warning.para: Do not hit steel parts with a steel hammer. Parts can break and cause serious personal injury.

step1.para: Remove the drive flange from the hub. If necessary, use a puller to remove the drive flange (Figure 11).

warning.para: When removing the adjusting nuts from the spindle, always use the correct size wrench socket. Never attempt to tighten or loosen the adjusting nuts by either hitting them directly with a hammer or by hitting a chisel or a drift placed against them with a hammer. Failure to do this can damage the nut, prevent a proper wheel bearing adjustment from being achieved, and cause possible loss of vehicle wheel-end equipment and serious personal injury.

step1.para: Remove the outer adjusting nut, lock washer and the inner adjusting nut from the spindle (Figure 12). Use the correct size wrench socket (4-7/8-inch) to remove the adjusting nut (Figure 13).

figure.caption: Figure 12. Remove Outer Adjusting Nut, Lock Washer, and Inner Adjusting Nut

warning.para: Use a plastic or leather mallet for assembly and disassembly procedures. Do not hit steel parts with a steel hammer. Pieces of a part can break off and cause serious personal injury.

step1.para: Remove the hub straight off the spindle. Prevent the outer bearing cone from failing when you remove the hub. If the hub is difficult to remove, tap it with a plastic or leather mallet to loosen it.
Remove the outer bearing cone from the hub.
